summary.p: SampleField generates samples from any type of input field and outputs the samples as a PointCloudField field.

description.p: SampleField generates samples from any type of input field and outputs the samples as a PointCloudField field. The samples can be generated randomly or user selected via a 3D widget.

The random sampling can be weighted by importance (determined by the data value of the sample) or left unweighted. The random sampling can also be limited to the selection of node points, rather than points from the interior of the fields elements, by clamping the samples to nodes.

The "uniform" distributions are a uniformly random function over the spacial extents of the field (i.e. the elements are weighted by their volume or area), whereas the "scattered" distributions are a uniformly random function over the elements only (i.e. all elements have the same weight). The "importance weighted" distributions multiply the existing weight of a sample by the interpolated data value associated with it, while the "not weighted" distributions leave the existing weight of a sample unchanged.
The UI has two main tabs which determine how the samples will be generated: Widget and Random.
The selected radio button determines which probability distribution function is used to generate random samples.
The number indicated is used to seed the random number generator.
SampleField will generate the number of samples indicated here.
Checking this box will force SampleField to select node points from the input field as samples, rather than any point from the interior of the fields elements.
The selected radio button determines the type of 3D widget used to select samples from the field. Currently only Rake is supported.

The number of samples selected by the chosen widget is determined by the collar slider(s) on the widget. The minimum number of samples is usually zero, sometimes higher. The maximum number is set here.
This button forces the SampleField module (and possibly downstream modules) to execute.
